results.content:
Good course for beginners. There is some humor in the lectures but not too much goofing around

Few things to criticize:
- for understanding the whole stack it would have been nice if at the end there would have been one small project that combines react, nodejs and mongo as a one full stack app. Now they just felt separated technologies
- mongodb was thought by going directly and only with testing with mocha. So it was more about testing and learning a bit of mongo on the side
- not criticizing so much about the teacher but that vs code sure have huge modals in that ide intellisense that hides half of the code on the screen when you try to follow the lecture
results.content_html:
Good course for beginners. There is some humor in the lectures but not too much goofing around

Few things to criticize:
- for understanding the whole stack it would have been nice if at the end there would have been one small project that combines react, nodejs and mongo as a one full stack app. Now they just felt separated technologies
- mongodb was thought by going directly and only with testing with mocha. So it was more about testing and learning a bit of mongo on the side
- not criticizing so much about the teacher but that vs code sure have huge modals in that ide intellisense that hides half of the code on the screen when you try to follow the lecture
